newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SOCCER-SANBA MAN'S HAT-TRICK HELPS MALAYSIA TO 7-0 WIN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SANBA MAN'S HAT-TRICK HELPS MALAYSIA TO 7-0 WIN.

text.p: Malaysian soccer fans found a
new hero on Wednesday in K. Sanbagamaran, dubbed `Sanba man' by
the local media, who netted a hat-trick as his side beat the
Philippines 7-0 to take the lead in group B of the Tiger Cup.
Archrivals Singapore, playing minnows Brunei, threatened a
goal rout with two scored in the opening four minutes but had to
settle for a 3-0 win with the final goal from the evergreen
Fandi Ahmad.
Malaysia now lead Singapore with more goals scored.
Thailand, double SEA Games champions, are in third place but
have a game in hand.
Sanbagamaran, a crucial link in coach Wan Jamak Hassan's
plans to rebuild the depleted Malaysian side after a
match-fixing scandal, first scored in the 36th minute.
He followed that up with goals in the 61st minute and in the
final seconds of the match.
Azman Adnan scored in the 43rd, while Samsruin Rahman bagged
goals in the 53rd and 81st minutes and M. Chandran scored in the
78th.
Singapore, cheered on by 25,000 fans, started with a goal
from Hasnim Haron in the first minute and a penalty from Steven
Tan three minutes later.
Ahmad's goal in the 51st minute sealed the win which eased
the pressure on coach Barry Whitbread, blasted in the local
press for the Lions' uninspiring opening 1-1 draw with Malaysia
on Sunday.
On Thursday, Myanmar open their campaign against Cambodia
while Laos play Vietnam.
